intro: Erythrodes triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed erythrodes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking red petals and three-lobed leaves, which give it its scientific name. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and produces small, fragrant flowers. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
